00029 bool KanaTable::loadConfig(const char* fileName, Knowledge::EncodeType src, Knowledge::EncodeType dest)
00030 {
00031     assert(fileName);
00032 
00033     Iconv iconv;
00034     if(! iconv.open(src, dest))
00035     {
00036         cerr << "error to open encoding conversion from " << src << " to " << dest << endl;
00037         return false;
00038     }
00039 
00040     // remove the previous tables if exist
00041     mapToHiragana_.clear();
00042     mapToKatakana_.clear();
00043 
00044     // open file
00045     ifstream from(fileName);
00046     if(! from)
00047     {
00048         return false;
00049     }
00050 
00051     // read file
00052     string line, hira, kata;
00053     istringstream iss;
00054 
00055 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00056     cout << "load kana mapping table: " << fileName << endl;
00057     cout << "src charset: " << src << endl;
00058     cout << "dest charset: " << dest << endl;
00059     cout << "Hiragana\tKatakana" << endl;
00060 #endif
00061 
00062     // each line is assumed in the format "Hiragana Katakana",
00063     // those lines not in this format would be ignored
00064     while(getline(from, line))
00065     {
00066         if (line.empty() || line[0] == ';' || line[0] == '#')
00067             continue;
00068 
00069         iss.clear();
00070         iss.str(line);
00071         iss >> hira >> kata;
00072 
00073         if(! iss)
00074         {
00075             cerr << "ignore the invalid kana mapping line: " << line << endl;
00076             continue;
00077         }
00078 
00079         // convert encoding
00080         if(! iconv.convert(&hira))
00081         {
00082             cerr << "error to convert encoding from " << src << " to " << dest << " for character " << hira << endl;
00083             return false;
00084         }
00085         if(! iconv.convert(&kata))
00086         {
00087             cerr << "error to convert encoding from " << src << " to " << dest << " for character " << kata << endl;
00088             return false;
00089         }
00090 
00091 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00092         cout << hira << "\t" << kata << endl;
00093 #endif
00094 
00095         mapToHiragana_[kata] = hira;
00096         mapToKatakana_[hira] = kata;
00097     }
00098 
00099     assert(mapToHiragana_.size() == mapToKatakana_.size() && "the Kana mapping table size should be the same.");
00100 #if JMA_DEBUG_PRINT
00101     cout << "total " << mapToHiragana_.size() << " kanas mapping are loaded" << endl << endl;
00102 #endif
00103 
00104     return true;
00105 }
00106 
00107 const char* KanaTable::toHiragana(const char* str) const
00108 {
00109     KanaMap::const_iterator it = mapToHiragana_.find(str);
00110     if(it == mapToHiragana_.end())
00111         return 0;
00112 
00113     return it->second.c_str();
00114 }
00115 
00116 const char* KanaTable::toKatakana(const char* str) const
00117 {
00118     KanaMap::const_iterator it = mapToKatakana_.find(str);
00119     if(it == mapToKatakana_.end())
00120         return 0;
00121 
00122     return it->second.c_str();
00123 }
